parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.05</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> GUI Control - Map </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Converts world coordinates into map screen coordinates. This command is identical to [[posWorldToScreen]]. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] position </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> control : [[Control]] - map control</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> position : [[Array]] - world position in format [[Position2D]] or [[Position3D]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] - screen coordinates in format [x, y] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_screenCoord = _control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] _worldCoord;</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>_screenCoord = _control [[ctrlMapWorldToScreen]] [[position]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[ctrlMapScreenToWorld]], [[posWorldToScreen]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">

<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on June 16, 2010
<dt class="note">[[User:kju|kju]]
<dd class="note">
This command returns a 2D array with the position on the active map display. Say the return [0.5.0.5] would mean that your input 3d world position, like [500,1000], is currently at the center of the active map display.<br>
In other words you can make the actual world position (of an object for example), relative to your active map display.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>

<h3 style="display:none">Bottom Section</h3>
